It's ideal hidden gem for wildlife enthusiasts and nature lovers.   2 to 3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Arambol Sweet Water Lake A Secluded Freshwater Oasis Arambol Sweet Water Lake is a hidden gem just a short walk from Arambol Beach. The freshwater lake offers a calm and refreshing break from the saltwater of the sea, set against a backdrop of natural beauty.   2 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Lamgau Caves A Peek into Goa's Ancient Past Lamgau Caves, located in North Goa, are ancient rock-cut caves that hold historical and religious significance. The caves are known for their intricate rock formations and serve as a window into Goa's rich past. They are a must-visit for history enthusiasts.   1 to 2 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Fort Tiracol A Historic Fort with Breathtaking Views Fort Tiracol is a 17th-century Portuguese fort located in North Goa, offering panoramic views of the Arabian Sea and Tiracol River. The fort has a rich history, having witnessed many battles over the centuries. Today, it serves as both a historical site and a heritage hotel.   2 to 3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Dr. Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary A Paradise for Bird Watchers Located on Chorao Island, Dr. Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary is a haven for bird lovers. Named after the famous ornithologist, the sanctuary is home to a variety of local and migratory birds. The peaceful surroundings make it a perfect escape into nature.   2 to 3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Cumbarjua Canal A Thrilling Encounter with Crocodiles The Cumbarjua Canal in North Goa is renowned for its thriving population of Mugger Crocodiles. It's one of the few places in Goa where these majestic creatures can be observed in their natural habitat. The canal's lush surroundings add to its allure.   2 to 3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Bamanbudo Waterfalls A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Goa Bamanbudo Waterfalls is a tranquil spot nestled in the forests of South Goa's Canacona district. The waterfall is unique, flowing down smooth rocks like a natural waterslide. It's a hidden gem, perfect for those seeking peace away from the busy beaches.   1 to 2 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Salaulim Dam The Quiet Corner of South Goa The Salaulim Dam sits on the banks of the Saulim River which is a tributary of the Zuari River. Located 5km from Sanguem Town, it is interesting to note that the entire drinking water of South Goa comes from here. The dam is spread on an area more than 24 sq. km and offers pleasant break from the beaches. 2-3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Morjim Beach Goa’s Very Own ‘Little Russia’ Morjim Beach in Goa is renowned for its pristine beauty. A great place to unwind, come here to have a gala time with loved ones. From soaking in the waters, to café hopping for some delicious Goan cuisine, Morjim Beach has it all! 2-3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Baina Beach Walk in the Waters Baina Beach is located near Vasco Da Gam and is famous for its fun water activities. Else, escape the city humdrum and revel in the tranquil environs as you walk on its sandy shorelines or bask in the sun! 2-3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Querim Beach The Tranquil Beach With white sands stretching over a patch of 2 km with rocky outcrops and many trees, Querim Beach, also known as Keri Beach is a quiet spot in North Goa. It is located at the mouth of the Terehkol River where it joins the Arabian Sea. The river inlet is one of the most striking features of the beach. 1-2 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Majorda Beach Live the Perfect Beach Life! Majorda Beach is situated in South Goa, it geographically features between Utorda Beach and Betalbatim Beach. The lovely golden sand beach is flanked by swaying palms trees and can be your perfect haunt for seeking some tranquillity from the city life. 2-3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Agonda Beach Tranquil Hub of South Goa A carpet of white sands dotted with colourful shacks, Agonda Beach is lined with swaying palm trees and serenely overlooks the azure Arabian Sea. One of the cleanest beaches of Goa, its usually less crowded and perfect for some downtime. 2-3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Varca Beach The Pretty Beach of South Goa Dotted with black lava rocks that sparkle in the green forest backdrop, the Varca beach is a white sandy shoreline that stretches for 12km. Flooded with tranquillity, the beach is ideal for those looking to connect with nature! 2-3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Butterfly Beach Idyllic Place for Nature Lovers One of the secluded beaches of Goa, Butterly Beach is located to the south of Palolem in Goa’s Cancona region. It is also known as the Honeymoon Beach and is in the shape of a butterfly and hides in a tiny cove encircled by dense trees. While direct transport does not ply here, if you travel by land, be ready for a forest hike. 2-3 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Netravali Bubbling Lake Unique Attraction of Goa Netravati Bubbling Lake is a holy water reservoir and part of the Gopinath Temple. It is very interesting to note that the water starts bubbling even more when someone claps.   1-2 hours Suggested Time EXPLORE Bhagwan Mahaveer Wildlife Sanctuary Goa’s Largest Protected Area Bhagwan Mahavir Wildlife Sanctuary is seated in Goa’s Sanguem district, around 70 km away from the main city. It spans 240 square kilometers, out of which 170 square kilometers is dedicated to the Mollem National Park built. Visitors seeking any kind of adventure and those looking for history and relaxation will find the perfect attractions in this tropical paradise. Goa is famous for being a special universe on its own which unites flea markets with temples alongside adventure sports with historic forts. The label "India’s pocket-sized paradise" accurately describes the destination because it perfectly combines sun along with sea and sand while presenting complete heritage elements. Must-Visit Beaches in Goa Beaches top the list of Goa places to visit. Below mentioned are the popular ones. Baga Beach: Baga Beach provides visitors with golden beaches and active night markets in addition to its exciting water sports selection. Calangute Beach: Along the coastline of Calangute Beach, visitors will discover the "Queen of Beaches" which welcomes hordes of tourists viewing numerous shacks and eating establishments. Anjuna Beach: Nature enthusiasts will discover their peace at Anjuna Beach because it provides cheap water sports alongside its famous flea market in a serene environment. Candolim Beach: Candolim Beach presents tourists with a peaceful environment because of its extended beaches. Palolem Beach: International tourists particularly favour Palolem Beach for its combination of cleanliness and picturesque beauty making it one of the best beaches in Goa. Top Water Activities in Goa You can take part in a number of water activities if you are looking for fun things to do in Goa. Banana Boat Ride: A thrilling group ride bouncing over the waves for an adrenaline rush. Catamaran Sailing: Enjoy a smooth sail along Goa’s coast with beautiful ocean views. Deep-Sea Fishing: Head into the Arabian Sea for a memorable fishing adventure. Popular Attractions in Goa Some other tourist attractions are mentioned below.
